name: OrderHandlingFlow
comment: This entity gives the details about a flow run.  The event is triggered when the flow level changes. For example, when the flow starts, completes, or encounters an error during the execution.
vf short description: This entity gives the details about a flow run.  The event is triggered when the flow level changes. For example, when the flow starts, completes, or encounters an error during the execution.

fields.name: OrderHandlingFlowSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: OrderHandlingFlowKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier to represent the order flow run in aLDM. Generated Key based on Flow Id and Flow Run Id

fields.name: FlowEventId
fields.comment: Identifier of the flow event. The event is triggered when the flow level changes. For example, when the flow starts, completes, or encounters an error during the execution. OHFlowTrackingNotification.eventId

fields.name: FlowEventDate
fields.comment: Creation date of the event. OHFlowTrackingNotification.eventTime

fields.name: FlowEventTypeInd
fields.comment: Name of the notification resource. OHFlowTrackingNotification.eventType

fields.name: ResourceVersionInd
fields.comment: Version of the associated resource entity OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.resourceVersion

fields.name: OrderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FlowId
fields.comment: Unique ID of the flow allocated to an order item in the order. An order can have multiple flows hence there can be multiple flow context IDs. In case a flow is not external and is running in Order Handling system, there is a flow context ID. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.id

fields.name: FlowName
fields.comment: Business name for the flow. This is identified by Order Resolver. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.flowName

fields.name: FlowTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates which type of flow it is, Business or Infra flow. Infra flow means technical flow, which business may not be aware of. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.flowType

fields.name: RootOrderItemSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ParentFlowId
fields.comment: Unique ID of the parent flow of the current flow. In case a flow is not external and is running in Order Handling system, there is a parent flow context ID. It is not populated if the flow does not have any parent flow. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.parentFlowId

fields.name: RootFlowId
fields.comment: Unique ID of the root flow in the hierarchy of the current flow. In case a flow is not external and is running in Order Handling system, there is a parent flow context ID. It is populated with the same flow ID if there is no parent flow for the current flow. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.rootFlowId

fields.name: FlowActionInd
fields.comment: Action that identifies what has changed for the flow (for example, Started, Ended, Error, AmendStart). The tracking persistence system derives the status based on this value. AmendStart is indication that an infra flow for amending this flow has started, this action is not presisted as status in history tracking. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.action

fields.name: FlowRunId
fields.comment: ID of the flow instance run.In case of a BPMN engine, this is the process instance ID returned by the engine.In case of Lite Orchestration, this is generated internally by the Order Handling framework. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.flowRunId

fields.name: OrchestrationTypeInd
fields.comment: Type of the orchestrator to which the flow was assigned. For example, Light Orchestrator or BPM engine (Camunda). Implementation can use its own orchestrator - for example, Amdocs Order Delivery Orchestrator (ODO). OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.orchestrationType

fields.name: TraceId
fields.comment: Trace ID for the flow history record. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.traceId

fields.name: FlowActionDate
fields.comment: Date and time when the action to be reported has happened for the flow. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.actionTime

fields.name: ModificationUserId
fields.comment: user id from the initiator token of the request that trigger flow changes. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.modifiedBy

fields.name: FlowErrorCode
fields.comment: Error code related to the failure. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.errorInfo.errorCode

fields.name: FlowErrorMessage
fields.comment: Error message related to the failure. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.errorInfo.errorMessage

fields.name: FlowErrorStackTraceDetail
fields.comment: Stack trace related to the failure. OHFlowTrackingNotification.flowTrackingEvent.errorInfo.stackTrace

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
